title: Kai'Sa is... Underwhelming
body:
She just seems worse than most ADCs in the bot lane. I don't see a reason to pick her over any other ADC.

Her attack range is 500? she get's out ranged in the bot lane, her enemy can poke her and she can't poke back. 

Her Q's targeting is awful, You can be in a minion wave with the enemy and all those Q rockets will hit minions...

Her W is meh, it does it's job. 

Her E is bad... She get's a speed buff, then an attack speed buff. But during her E animation she can't attack??? 

And her R is on too long of a cooldown, its a gloried Tristana W with a super long cooldown.

she has no escapes, no cc, and no way to escape assassins. Vayne can go invis and pin them, Ashe has her ult and her slows, Lucian has a dash, Varus has his ult and slow, Jinx has her root and slow, Quinn can kick away and blind, Kalista can dash and dodge, Caitlyn has traps and a sorta dash. Kai'Sa has a small speed buff? 

She's a very underwhelming champion that definitely needs some buffs if you want her to be viable.

replies.body: I could be wrong, but i dont think she will be an adc.  Im thinking mid jg or top.
Riot historically hard nerfs marksmen junglers, Kindred and Graves being the most notable two. If she ends up in jungle she's gonna get gutted because marksmen junglers are just an unhealthy design.

Kindred had ridiculous sustain and dueling power. So they had to nerf them (remove that sustain).
Graves had some anicancel problems and was too tanky.

I don't think marksmen in the jungle are unhealthy.

Kindred hasn't been nerfed and if the kindred is good at playing her, can 100% guarantee 4 stacks by 6 minutes into the game. She's stronger than she ever was, because her range is one of the highest in the game among adcs and also side steps a lot so skill shots are hard to hit. You can't even reach a good kindred with Udyr anymore.

If you want to know what I mean by 100% guaranteeing stacks: She can 100% set up exactly where the next mark is going to spawn. If she is cycling and guaranteeing all qualified monsters are dead, every time her jungle marks are ready to spawn.... it will 100% spawn on the next camp eligible to revive. So if both wraith camps are dead, and she kills a marked Scuttle, the OTHER scuttle will 100% be the next mark. She can go and wait for it, and kill it the very second it gets marked. And then the next mark will 100% be the opposing jungler's Wraiths. Meanwhile..... the other jungler is trying to get reds.... blues, gank, etc, and can't get around the map as fast as her. I have tried to keep up with her calculations and tried to beeline for spawns as soon as they appear on the map, and a good kindred will have it dead as soon as it spawns, so the other jungler will always be behind.

Old Kindred didn't have range increases. She was killable. New kindred if played right is unstoppable.

By nerfed, maybe they were referring to her stacks going from stacking true damage, to stacking amplification on her abilities.  Honestly, I think that did hit her pretty hard.  

She's still viable, but has gone from a tank shredder to an assassin-y (jungler) ad.
Kindred never had true damage, it was % health on-hit.
You're right.  That's what I was thinking of.

She never had true damage, and you're referring to her on hit % damage, which has been moved autonomously to her W and E (attacks on its own, and E has BOTH missing HP mods AND Max HP mods (max HP crit damage bonus if below 15% + 50% of their critical strike; in other words, a crit kindred can deal 275% damage crits with E to targets below 65% of their total HP if 100% crit)

And before, marks were randomized. Your first mark position could be a Krug or a red/blue buff. They were completely randomized, which meant you were either feast or famine, and had a low attack range. The change to prioritize only 4 total camps made her MUCH more powerful.

She is still a tank shredder.... with Missing HP damage, Current HP damage, AND Max HP damage.

Riot themselves. Watch her spotlight.

Marksman =/= ADC.

if your strat is to throw pellets to the enemy via basic attacks, then she's not the right tool for that. just by looking at her kit is evident that she's ment to be a versatile ranged asassin. 

building for burst? -> stack AD, but Q is meant to be high power when used against isolated targets, not wasting it on minion waves.

building for long range sharpshooting? -> stack AP, nothing to say from that, skillshot working as intended i guess

building for actual DPS? -> stack AS, the invisibility while in channel is meant to work as Twitch's invisibility, you use it to prepare for the ambush not to do invisible rolls midfight like Vayne.

she's more akin to an Strategic Cruiser from EVE Online. she can focus on short range missile barrage, long range gunnery or covert ops ganking with short range DPS depending on what you build on her.

i'd buy her for the versatility not because she will be the FoTM peashooter in botlane.

This is totally true! 

I see this argument a lot and I think the only reason people **_are_** calling her an ADC is because she was advertised as a bot lane champ on her release, not just a Marksman. I admit when I saw her I was pretty sure she would also be a competent Jungler not unlike Kindred or Graves or Quinn, but a lot of people are hung up on this particular aspect not because they aren't paying attention to her kit, but because Riot advertised her first and foremost IN the ADC position. There are also a lot of ADCs in the game I wouldn't qualify as peashooters! And they have all had success bot lane, focusing on their abilities (Jhin/Xayah) I'm pretty sure in the coming weeks we'll see her tuned either more for bot, or Jungle.

Range in the bot lane isnt everything. She is mobile and able to reposition  quickly. If you can out manuver the enemy you can out damage them. She is ment to kite and get up close and fill ya with holes faster then you can blink. Also she is a fantastic jg.

Our maneuver the enemy with what? The only maneuver you have locks you out of auto attacking. 

She has no mobility.

Press e, move fast, avoid skill shots, and ranged aoe, negate slows, place self better to do damage at a high rate. Not to mention channel time is short. It gets shorter the more  basics you do. Have enough as you can cloak, even better for repositioning. More as means more stacks of passive. More stacks means more damage. So shoot fast to shoot faster, move faster, and do more hurty.

You're exactly right. There's no reason to pick her over other ADCs. Vayne does everything she does better. I think something that would make her immediately more fun would be resets on her R after kills/assists.
Shes how an ADC should be in a game where most ADCs are broken as hell.
I mean, ADCs are broken yeah, but if Riot wants all ADCs to be good and broke why make Kai'Sa so bad

I think they are still just ignoring that long ranged Right click burst per second ADCs are broken and actually thought that Kai'sa could compete by being a more in your face ADC. 

Good thing: It showed up again how broken existing ADCs are.

Her Q is exactly the way it should be.
It's an isolation spell.
Yes, it's worse against clumped enemies.
Yes, that's the point.

The rest of her kit needs a lot of work.

I'm personally fine with her attack range being bad, but that should be made up for elsewhere.

Her W is exactly what it needs to be. Nothing more, nothing less.

Her E's AA lockout just means you have to use it properly.
If you have no AS, you just have to use it prior to fighting.
Once you have AS, the lockout is so short that it's comparable to the animation of a dash or jump, with the bonus of having invisibility and free movement, as opposed to the predetermined trajectory of most dashes.
My only problem with this spell is that it's painfully generic. Trist and Xayah also have generic steroids, but they at least feel good to use.
Supercharge just doesn't have that OOMPH.

The R CD should be shorter, no question.

I agree with this just about 99%. I think there are a few changes they could do to make her feel a bit more responsive, obviously not all these changes should be made TOGETHER but they would need to find a proper balance in picking one or two.

--> Make the cap for evolving her abilities a bit lower (2 item first upgrade is pretty harsh, 100% attack speed is the most difficult to reach usually also requiring AS boots)

--> Lower the CD on her R OR up the range of her R with the same CD

--> R CD reduction on assist or kill.

--> Shorted the cast animation on her W (it feels a bit sluggish to fire, and roots me into an animation. It's also not an option for close range combat for that reason, despite doing a good chunk of damage.) 

--> Increase her AA range to 525 - 550 (This to compete with other ADCs if they want her to be viable bot lane)

This all depends on where they would like to see her. I really like her as an adc personally, but I definitely don't really pop off until two items in (plus boots) and that's a long time to wait. She can't take the typical spread of one damage item, one AS item early like most adcs to give them better rounded stats, because she needs to prioritize her first upgrade. She struggles with taking a lot of poke, and I've seen a lot of people picking Caitlyn into her on release just to troll.

I have seen kai'sa's dominate the rift and vice versa. I therefore do not think that the champion is at fault here but the players who are playing her. Note that, there are currently many Overpowered champs in the game and if kai'sa seems weak is not because she is UP but rather those other champs need nerfs. If you want her to be strong , i am sorry but she would have to be made OP so that makes another champ in the roaster that gets added in the OP list.

Kai'Sa can build into 3 things to get different bonuses, this alone is enough to have her harder than 90% of the other ADCs who only have a single build, with the exception of Varus that can adapt to the meta demands.

I played with 2 Kai'Sa today as a support (Taric) and I got to say that the girl has all the right cards to become extremely powerful. Any kind of coordination in the team boosts her performance by a frekaing lot and the execution-like passive can secure a lot of kills if you add ehr mobility.
She is supposed to be an adc , but a new type one , and she is pretty strong , players will need sometime to learn her

The most poorly designed champion Riot has released in a while IMO.

I mean I know shes new and all, but SUB 40% winrate is so bad its actually cringey that Riot allowed her to be released, even with MANY high-elo players telling Riot 'Hey, she seems trash'

Her AD ratios are so obscene that they invalidate any reason to build AP instead. You basically pick between either on hit or bog standard AD Crit. All of her AD ratios need to be halved and her passive's AP scaling doubled in exchange.

As ADC you need a good support to cover your weaknesses and at least a bit of CC so you can engage.

I think {{champion:12}} {{champion:432}}  {{champion:412}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:37}}  could work well.

With TK you could use dorans ring and just push with Q, he can help you escape.

{{champion:40}} is probably not so good when you are getting outranged because her shield cd is way too long and you  have no way to initiate good trades or heal up. {{champion:117}} might be enough of a threat to zone enemies a bit but same problem, it's easy to play around shields when you completely rely on it.

{{champion:53}} {{champion:89}} who also offer no sustain and only have the option to go all in are probably way too risky. You fuck up once and thats it, lane lost, they also can't simply not engage because then you get harassed and zoned. {{champion:201}} also falls into that cathegory. If he doesn land Q's so you can follow up with a stun for a good trade, you will get bullied out of lane.

She works fairly well mid.  Her Q and her being AD makes her waveclear decent enough, she has fair burst and poke with Q, passive, and W, and her E works well enough to dodge skillshots decently well.

She doesn't really seem to be made for botlane. Think she's better off in a solo lane or the jungle as a skirmisher/ assassin. She's kind of like a ranged {{champion:121}} actually, in that she's much more dangerous when your target has no one near (including minions). It makes W easier to hit (IT HURTS when you land it and it allows her to R to her target) and ensures you get a full Q off. 

I'm actually doing fairly well jungling her. My build is {{item:1412}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3115}}. This gives me a decent chunk of AD/AP/AS and gives me every evolution. Haven't gotten much further than that yet. Don't know if she'd be better off with AD or AP from that point on, although that would also depend on your and the enemy team composition. I'm inclined to default to AP though given that people won't expect you to do a lot of magic damage and peoples' tendency to pick AD squishies at my elo (Silver peasant). She also takes a while to really take off, but once you've reached critical mass you're very powerful.

If she could just Q while using E, that would be satisfactory.

Otherwise, a good champion to main. Play every role except support.
I agree she does feel a bit underwhelming, but give her a week or two.

She's just released into a meta that doesn't favour her.
current meta, atleast in high elo's, mostly favours hyper carries and front to back teamfights.
Kai'sa, like lucian and jhin who also struggle alot lately, prefers scatered figths where she can duel isolated targets or clean up woundet opponents rather than straight 5v5.
I'm pretty sure she'll work much better as midlane or jungle, her main strength after all is that she can join fights from a long distance with her ult which makes her really good on roaming positions.
